channel.title: E203: Intro to International Economics | Joseph M. Westenberg

item.title: Project Part 1
item.description:
1. Pick a WTO dispute case from their website (Will require some searching!) Report the following:
  • Who are the 2 main countries?
  • What is (are) the main sector(s) in question? Ensure that a specific good is mentioned, this will be important for the rest of the project.
  • What is the time frame of the case? When was it first brought to the WTO? When did it resolve?
  • Define, in general, what is the violation? Some cases may be clear, others may be filled with technical jargon. (Hint: Its probably in your best interest to find one not filled with jargon!)
  • Ensure that you can find the trade flow data for this good for the five years leading up to the case, while the case is active and five years after it has been resolved.
  • Include a link to the WTO dispute case.
  1. Data Collection: For each of the two main countries collect the following data for each of the +/- 5 years of the dispute.
  • Total Exports
  • Total Imports
  • GDP
  • Total exports to the other main country
  • Now within the main sector in question:
    • Exports of both countries
    • Imports of both countries
    • Exports to the other main country

item.title: Project Part 2
item.description:
First Draft

1000 words. Address points below as well as a description of your case from part 1 of the project. All figures should be included in the paper and clearly labeled.

  1. Plot: For each of the 2 main countries plot for the +/- 5 years of the dispute
  • Trade-to-GDP ratio
  • One main country’s share of other’s in total exports
  • Within the main sector
    • Exports
    • Imports
    • Exports to the other main country
    • One main country’s share in other’s exports
  1. Does this violation in general go against the WTO’s primary purpose “to open trade for the benefit of all”? Using the material we learned this semester argue how this violation impacts trade.
  2. Given the plots you have made with various trade statistics. Which (if any) are relevant for your case and why?
  3. How many other cases have there been which these two countries were main complainants/respondents? Are many of these cases around the same time of your case? If so, how many?
  4. Was there a final ruling of this case? If not what ruling would you make as a WTO official? If there was, do you agree with it? Support your answer with data and the economics we have learned.
